intro: Locandi madagascariensis, commonly known as the Madagascar locanda, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and woody stems. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments within the rainforests of Madagascar. Its leaves are usually elliptical and have a smooth surface, while its flowers are often white or pale pink. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
